alert.note: Alert for Howell (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 04 at 9:54AM CST until March 07 at 9:25PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Dent, Howell, Oregon and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Douglas, Laclede, Ozark, Webster and Wright. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 954 AM CST, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the advisory area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Lick Creek at County Road 528, Beaver Creek at County Road 524, Howell Creek at County Road 9790, Bryant Creek at County Road 223, Pond Fork at County Road 883, Little North Fork River at County Road 916 and Beaver Creek at Crewes Ford Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Plains, Mountain Grove, Ava, Mountain View, Willow Springs, Houston, Licking, Cabool, Mansfield, Gainesville, Norwood, Hartville, Summersville, Raymondville, Bakersfield, Morgan, Dawson, Pomona, Theodosia, South Fork, Pontiac, Brandsville, Huggins, Wasola, Plato, Twin Bridges, Sundown, Vanzant, Drury, Gentryville, Dora, Elk Creek, Siloam Springs, Bendavis, Simmons, Brushyknob, Graff, Rockbridge, Solo and Sycamore. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
